Package com.ibm.streams.management.job

Interface PeInputPortMXBean

All Superinterfaces:
PePortMXBean
public interface PeInputPortMXBean extends PePortMXBean
PeInputPortMXBean provides attributes and operations for managing a processing element (PE) input port of a Streams job.

Note: The job must be registered before accessing any of these attributes or operations. See InstanceMXBean.registerJob(BigInteger) for more information.

ObjectNameBuilder.peInputPort(String, String, BigInteger, int) can be used to build the ObjectName for a PeInputPortMXBean.

The JobMXBean snapshot and PeMXBean snapshot operations provide an option to include attributes of descendant objects in the generated snapshot. If the value of the maximumDepth parameter identifies PE input port attributes should be included in the snapshot, the JSON format of the PE input port information returned is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Get PE input port. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

  • The REST specific properties: resourceType, restid, and self are not included.
  • The related job, and pe attributes are not repeated for the PE input port.
  • The metrics, property is not included.
  • The connections property is only included if the maximumDepth parameter on the submit call indicates it should be included. The value for this property is an embedded array containing snapshot objects for each optional connection of the PE input port. It includes only optional connections; required connections are included as child objects of PE output ports. For the format of these objects, see: PeConnectionMXBean.

    Set<OperatorPortInformation>

    • TYPE

      static final String TYPE
      TYPE is used to identify this bean as a PE input port bean when building the bean's ObjectName. The value is "domain.instance.pe.port.input"

  • Method Details

    • getOperatorInputPorts

      Set<OperatorPortInformation> getOperatorInputPorts()
      Returns the operator name and port index for the operator input ports associated with the PE input port.
      Returns:
      the operator input port information.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperatorInputPortMXBean
